episodeTitle: The Incredible Battle Starts! Luffy vs Luffy
episodeTitleJapanese: 超絶バトルスタート！ ルフィVSルフィ
episodeTitleRomanized: Chōzetsu Batoru Sutāto! Rufi tai Rufi
description: Nightmare Luffy, powered by 100 shadows, emerges to save his crew from Oars and Gecko Moria. With enhanced strength and speed, he has only 10 minutes to defeat both opponents before the shadows leave his body.

events.title: Zoro Attacks Oars with Yasha Garasu
events.description: Zoro attempts to strike Oars' right arm using his Three Sword Style technique Yasha Garasu (Yaksha Crow). The attack involves Zoro spinning like a rolling wheel while continuously thrusting his swords, leaving cuts shaped like crow's feet.
events.significance: First use of Zoro's Yasha Garasu technique, though Zoro is ultimately defeated when Oars knees him into a wall.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro attacks Oars' arm to give Usopp an opening

events.title: Zoro Defeated by Oars
events.description: Despite his attack, Zoro is knocked unconscious when Oars knees him powerfully into a wall, incapacitating the swordsman.
events.significance: Shows the overwhelming power of Oars, leaving the Straw Hats in a desperate situation with their strongest fighters down.

events.title: Usopp's Salt Attack Intercepted
events.description: Usopp fires Brook's salt into Oars' mouth using his Kuwagata slingshot, attempting to purify the zombie. However, Moria's shadow catches the salt and throws it out, breaking the bag and rendering it useless.
events.significance: The failure of the salt strategy eliminates one of the Straw Hats' key weapons against the zombies, forcing them to rely on raw strength alone.

events.title: Oars Crushes Usopp and Nami
events.description: Oars crushes Usopp under his massive foot. When Nami tries to plead for his life, Oars crushes her as well. Moria then orders the giant zombie to crush all the unconscious Straw Hats to ensure they're dead.
events.significance: The darkest moment of the battle, with the Straw Hats facing apparent death before Nightmare Luffy's arrival.

quotes.text: Crush those who are out cold to make sure they're dead!
quotes.speaker: Gecko Moria
quotes.context: Moria orders Oars to finish off the Straw Hats

events.title: Nightmare Luffy's Dramatic Entrance
events.description: Nightmare Luffy appears, revealing he has saved Usopp and Nami from Oars' crushing attack. His appearance is dramatically different - pale blue skin, considerably taller and bulkier than normal, with an intimidating presence.
events.significance: The debut of Nightmare Luffy, one of Luffy's most unique power-ups, created by absorbing 100 shadows from the Rolling Pirates and other victims on Thriller Bark.

quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Nami and Usopp are shocked by Luffy's transformed state

events.title: Nightmare Luffy's Enhanced Abilities Revealed
events.description: Luffy demonstrates his dramatically increased strength and speed from the 100 shadows. His speed is so great that Usopp and Nami had no idea they had been rescued. He also displays unexpected swordsmanship skills from one of the absorbed shadows.
events.significance: Reveals the extent of Nightmare Luffy's power enhancement, showing he can match and exceed Oars' strength while gaining abilities he never possessed before.

events.title: Nightmare Luffy vs Oars Begins
events.description: Luffy learns that his entire crew has been beaten and becomes deadly serious. He declares there is only one Luffy and prepares to fight both Oars and Moria with only 10 minutes before the shadows leave his body.
events.significance: The beginning of the climactic battle between Nightmare Luffy and Oars, representing the culmination of the Thriller Bark arc's conflict.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his uniqueness before fighting Oars, his shadow's host

events.title: Nightmare Luffy Blocks Oars' Gomu Gomu no Rifle
events.description: Nightmare Luffy effortlessly blocks Oars' Gomu Gomu no Rifle attack with one hand, demonstrating his vastly superior strength. This same technique would normally require significant effort from regular Luffy.
events.significance: Demonstrates the massive power gap between Nightmare Luffy and Oars, showing that with 100 shadows, Luffy can easily counter his own signature moves.

events.title: Nightmare Luffy Overpowers Oars
events.description: Nightmare Luffy grabs Oars by the hair and swings the massive zombie around like a sack, then slams him into the ground with devastating force. The impact is so great it scares away all the zombie soldiers watching.
events.significance: Shows the complete reversal of power dynamics, with Nightmare Luffy manhandling the previously unstoppable Oars.

events.title: Nightmare Luffy Displays Swordsmanship
events.description: Nightmare Luffy reveals acquired stellar sword skills, an ability he never possessed before. This comes from one of the 100 shadows belonging to a skilled swordsman.
events.significance: Demonstrates that Nightmare Luffy doesn't just gain raw power, but also inherits the skills and abilities of the shadow owners.

events.title: Gecko Moria Attempts to Escape
events.description: Seeing Nightmare Luffy's overwhelming power, Gecko Moria attempts to flee the battle. However, Luffy is too fast and won't let him escape.
events.significance: Shows that even the Warlord of the Sea Gecko Moria recognizes the threat Nightmare Luffy poses and chooses retreat over continuing the fight.

events.title: Nightmare Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Pistol on Moria
events.description: Nightmare Luffy catches up to the fleeing Gecko Moria and punches him with a devastating Gomu Gomu no Pistol, sending the Warlord flying through the air.
events.significance: First time in the episode that Nightmare Luffy lands a direct hit on Gecko Moria, showing he can fight both Oars and Moria simultaneously.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Nightmare Luffy strikes Moria with enhanced power

events.title: Nightmare Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Storm
events.description: Nightmare Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Balloon to inflate and dodge, then twists his body up before untwisting and launching his finishing move: Gomu Gomu no Storm, sending Oars flying with a rapid barrage of punches.
events.significance: The climactic attack of the episode, demonstrating the full power of Nightmare Luffy's enhanced abilities with his signature technique.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Nightmare Luffy's devastating finishing attack on Oars

events.title: The Shadows Leave Nightmare Luffy
events.description: After defeating both Oars and Moria, the 100 shadows begin to leave Luffy's body as the 10-minute time limit expires. Luffy returns to his normal form, having apparently won the battle.
events.significance: Marks the end of the Nightmare Luffy transformation and sets up the question of whether the battle is truly over.

events.title: Rolling Pirates Tend to Injured Straw Hats
events.description: While Nightmare Luffy battles Oars and Moria, the Rolling Pirates led by Lola work to get the heavily injured Straw Hat crew members to safety.
events.significance: Shows the alliance between the Straw Hats and the Rolling Pirates, and the bonds formed during the Thriller Bark adventure.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Nightmare Luffy declaring his uniqueness before fighting Oars

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro attacks Oars with his new technique

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Nightmare Luffy's devastating finishing attack on Oars

themes.description: The Rolling Pirates sacrifice their shadows to empower Luffy, demonstrating the bonds formed between crews and the willingness to help others even at great personal cost.
themes.symbolism: The 100 shadows represent the collective strength of all Thriller Bark's victims uniting to defeat their oppressor.

themes.description: Nightmare Luffy represents immense temporary power, but with a strict time limit. The episode explores the trade-off between overwhelming strength and sustainability.
themes.symbolism: The blue, ghostly appearance of Nightmare Luffy symbolizes borrowed power rather than true strength.

themes.description: The 'Luffy vs Luffy' concept explores identity as Luffy fights Oars who contains his shadow. His declaration 'There's only one Luffy' reinforces his unique identity.
themes.symbolism: Oars with Luffy's shadow represents a dark reflection - having Luffy's abilities but none of his heart or restraint.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy takes on a completely new form to save his crew, showing his willingness to accept any power necessary to protect his friends. His serious demeanor as Nightmare Luffy contrasts sharply with his usual personality.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended several battle sequences to increase dramatic tension and showcase Nightmare Luffy's abilities in greater detail than the manga.

trivia.fact: This is the final episode to use 'Jungle P' by 5050 as the opening theme, marking the end of Opening 9 which ran from Episode 326-372.
Mayumi Tanaka voices both Luffy and Oars in the Japanese version, meaning she is essentially voicing both sides of the 'Luffy vs Luffy' battle.

sources.title: Mayumi Tanaka - Behind The Voice Actors

trivia.fact: Nightmare Luffy can contain 100 shadows due to his exceptionally strong spirit, while most normal people can only contain 2-3 shadows before losing consciousness.
This episode adapts chapters 478 and 479 of the manga, covering nearly two full chapters worth of content.
The episode aired on September 28, 2008 in Japan, during the height of the Thriller Bark arc's popularity.
Zoro's Yasha Garasu technique makes its debut in this episode, adding to his repertoire of Three Sword Style techniques.
